passage_text: 1 Windows Default Themes-The default themes included with Windows 8 that you can use to personalize your PC. 2  These themes are located in the folder below. 3  C:\Windows\Resources\Themes. 4  Installed Themes-Themes that were created by your PC manufacturer (OEM) or other non-Microsoft providers.

You can store other themes here; C:\Windows\Web\Wallpaper. Place each image or images of the same theme in a folder (ie. Snow images in a folder named Winter or Holiday images in a folder named Holidays). Downloaded several W7 theme packs but went to a temp folder I have rather then into the themes folder.

Example: 1  Create an empty folder on C:\ named Themes. 2  Open cmd with administrative mode. 3  Go to an user themes location: 4  cd C:\Users\MyUser\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows. 5  To make things easier, open an explorer windows using the command: 6  start. 7  Move (if exists) the contents of the folder 'Themes' to C:\Themes. 8  Delete (if exists) the now empty ....

The contents of the theme files are located in the Windows folder in System Drive. The system default themes are located at: C:\Windows\Resources\Themes. I would recommend you to follow the article below for creating themes.
Windows Themes are easy to work with but a pain to find the actual files for. The .theme file itself is actually nothing more than plain text settings, similar to an .ini file.

1 These themes are located in the folder below. 2  C:\Windows\Resources\Themes. 3  Installed Themes-Themes that were created by your PC manufacturer (OEM) or other non-Microsoft providers. 4  High Contrast Themes-Themes that help improve your PC's performance or make items on your screen easier to see.

Windows 7 introduced a theme format called themepack. All themepack Windows 7 desktop themes are stored in C:\Users\yourusername\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\Themes. If you can’t see the folder, you might want to read our tutorial how to get access to AppData. The second folder C:\Windows\Resources\Themes is the actual folder where the “real” desktop themes are stored in Windows 7. If you want to install Windows 7 themes (custom themes), then you need to copy the files in there.

1 C:\Users\(user-name)\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\Themes. 2  Windows Default Themes-The default themes included with Windows 8 that you can use to personalize your PC. 3  These themes are located in the folder below.
